titleStmt.title: T. S. Ogdoas in R. H. Prognosticon.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: T. S. Ogdoas in R. H. Prognosticon.

monogr.title: An astrological discourse : vpon the great and notable coniunction of the tvvo superiour planets, Saturne & Iupiter, which shall happen the 28. day of April, 1583. With a briefe declaration of the effectes, which the late eclipse of the Sunne 1582. is yet heerafter to woorke. Written newly by Richard Haruey: partely, to supplie that is wanting in co [m] mon prognostications: and partely by prædiction of mischiefes ensuing, either to breed some endeuour of preuention by foresight, so farre as lyeth in vs: or at leastwise, to arme vs with pacience beforehande. Seen and allowed
monogr.author: Harvey, Richard

imprint.publisher: Watkins, Richard, Assignees (with assent, etc.) of

div.head: T. S. Ogdoas in R. H. Prognosticon.
div.l: Spirat in ore Furor, Baccho{que} & Apolline dignus,
Ergò agite Anglorum proceres, legitote Prophetā,
Vade Liber, liberi ingenij, genij{que} beati
